meanings.definition: The quality or state of being windy or breezy.
meanings.sent1: The blowiness of the weather made flying a kite easy.
meanings.sent2: I love the blowiness of a fresh breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The blowiness of the wind messed up my hair, making me look like a wild animal!
meanings.sent4: The blowiness of the wind carried the scent of flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The blowiness of the wind rustled the leaves, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being inflated or puffed up.
meanings.sent1: The blowiness of the balloon made it float effortlessly in the air.
meanings.sent2: The blowiness of the inflatable mattress made it comfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The blowiness of the puffer fish made it look like a spiky ball.
meanings.sent4: The blowiness of the clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The blowiness of the bubble gum made it pop loudly when touched.

meanings.definition: The act of blowing or being blown.
meanings.sent1: The blowiness of the wind knocked over the trash cans.
meanings.sent2: The blowiness of the fan provided relief on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The blowiness of the party horn startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The blowiness of the hurricane caused widespread damage.
meanings.sent5: The blowiness of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
